text: ban bail is a popular vietnamese street
food that originates from the imperial
city of hue in the central of vietnam it
is a rice cake steamed in a small bowl
topped with savory toppings of your
choice like shrimps or pork rice and
serve with vietnamese light dipping
sauce today i'm gonna show you how to
make this delicate and special dish of
hair let's begin
ingredients you will need 130 grams of
rice flour 70 grams of tapioca starch
lime shallot garlic chilies and scallion
300 gram shrimp crispy pork rice sugar
a natural oil vegetable oil fish sauce
and salt in a large mixing bowl combine
the rice flour tapioca starch and 500ml
of water and stir well let the butter
sit for one to two hours to reduce the
strong flour smell after one to two
hours the flour gonna settle to the
bottom leaving a layer of clear water on
top remove the clear water and
compensate with the same amount of fresh
water also add 100ml of hot water a
tablespoon of vegetable oil a pinch of
salt and stir well
you will need a couple dozens of small
bowls like these grease the bowl with
some vegetable oil then steam over high
heat until the bowls are really warm
then fill the bowls with the butter and
steam for about five to eight minutes
depending on the size of the bowl if the
steamer and the bowls are hot enough the
rice cake will have really cute dimples
on them
for the topping defend the shrimps then
boil until cooked through
[Music]
peel and crush well in the mortar and
pestle season the shrimp with some fish
sauce pepper and an extra oil transfer
the shrimps into a dry pan keep stirring
over medium low heat until dry and
separated to make the dipping sauce
combine the shell of the shrimps with 2
3 cup of water in a small saucepan and
bring to a boil for about 5 minutes then
add 2 tbsp sugar and 2 tbsp of fish
sauce stir to dissolve the sugar and
turn off the heat leave to cool crust
one green chili with a spoon combine
with the sauce we made in a bowl top
with some minced garlic
[Music]
now arrange the rice cake on a tray top
each one with some scallion oil and then
the shrimp flakes don't forget a piece
of crispy pork rice and drizzle the
sweet and savory fish sauce right before
serving such a savory and delicate bite
that the vietnamese emperor used to love
i hope you love them too don't forget to
like the video and subscribe to my
channel for recipes like this i will see
you there next time bye
[Music]
you
